page.title: 18Children's Games
page.content: A report based on a study of children between the ages of 5 & l2 (Traditional Games) are played, some involving simple equipment like a ball or some rope. Boys enjoy sporting games and girls enjoy hopscotch, skipping, leap frog and "two bally". Chants are used to enhance play. Children also copy the exploits of their television heroes. Not all schools have a grassed area. Outside school, parks and playing fields are available. A lot of children play in the streets. Bikes are popular and boys would like to take them to school for play purposes. (Family Games) are played at home. Some children read at nights and some play on their computers. Group games are very common, usually, but not always, children tend to play games which get them into trouble.
